title: 108_hr3052
content: The Act titled "State Accountability and Identity Fraud Elimination Act of 2004" allows for the withholding of funds for the enactment of a law allowing issuance of identification cards or driver's licenses for certain individuals. The Act "State Accountability and Identity Fraud Elimination Act of 2004" permits withholding funds if a State enacts a law allowing issuance of identification cards or driver's licenses for specific individuals under Sec. 165 of title 23, United States Code. The Secretary will withhold increasing percentages of apportioned funds for fiscal years 2006, 2007, and 2008 if the State enacts the specified law. The Secretary will withhold increasing percentages of apportioned funds for fiscal years 2008, 2009, and 2010 if a State enacts a law described in paragraph (7) on or before specific dates. The Secretary will withhold increasing percentages of apportioned funds for fiscal years 2008, 2009, and 2010 if a State enacts a law allowing the issuance of identification cards or driver's licenses to unauthorized aliens. Funds withheld before September 30, 2005, will remain available for three fiscal years, while funds withheld after that date will have no expiration. The Secretary will withhold funds from apportionment to any State if they enact a law allowing identification cards for unauthorized aliens. Funds withheld before September 30, 2005, will be available for three fiscal years, while funds withheld after that date will have no expiration. If a State repeals the law, the withheld funds will be apportioned back to the State and remain available for expenditure until the end of the third fiscal year following the fiscal year in which they were apportioned. The Secretary will withhold funds from apportionment to any State if they enact a law allowing identification cards for unauthorized aliens. Funds withheld will be available for three fiscal years, and if the State does not repeal the law, the funds shall lapse. The Secretary will withhold funds from any State enacting a law allowing identification cards for unauthorized aliens.
